alert.note: Alert for Iron; Kane; Washington (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 02 at 1:24PM MDT until August 02 at 3:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHEASTERN IRON, NORTHWESTERN KANE AND SOUTHEASTERN WASHINGTON COUNTIES... At 124 PM MDT, Zion National Park Rangers have observed active flash flooding in Twin Brothers Canyon, with additional flash flooding likely ongoing in other areas. Between 0.5 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Zion National Park Rangers. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of slot canyons, normally dry washes, creeks and rivers, and roadways that cross these washes. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Zion National Park, La Verkin, Apple Valley, Hildale, Virgin, Springdale, Kanarraville, Rockville and Kolob Canyon. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
